title: Labor Market Effects of UBI in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What are the two competing effects on labor supply when implementing UBI?
choices: Income effect and substitution effect
Demand effect and supply effect
Formal effect and informal effect
Entrepreneurial effect and employment effect
questions.answer: Income effect and substitution effect

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the 'income effect' of UBI on labor supply?
choices: Individuals may choose to work more as their basic needs are met
Individuals may choose to work less as their basic needs are met
Employers may offer higher wages to attract workers
The demand for labor increases in the formal sector
questions.answer: Individuals may choose to work less as their basic needs are met

questions.question: What is the 'substitution effect' of UBI on labor supply?
choices: Workers substitute formal employment for informal employment
Employers substitute capital for labor
Work becomes more attractive as individuals keep more of their earnings
UBI substitutes for other social welfare programs
questions.answer: Work becomes more attractive as individuals keep more of their earnings

questions.question: How might UBI affect labor demand in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would definitely decrease labor demand
It would have no effect on labor demand
It might increase demand due to increased consumer spending
It would only affect labor demand in the public sector
questions.answer: It might increase demand due to increased consumer spending

questions.question: What characterizes Timor-Leste's current labor market?
choices: A large formal sector with minimal informal employment
Equal distribution between formal and informal sectors
A large informal sector and limited formal private sector jobs
Predominantly public sector employment
questions.answer: A large informal sector and limited formal private sector jobs

questions.question: How might UBI affect the transition between formal and informal employment in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would have no effect on sector transitions
It might encourage transitions from informal to formal employment
It would definitely cause all informal workers to seek formal employment
It would force all formal workers into the informal sector
questions.answer: It might encourage transitions from informal to formal employment

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on entrepreneurship in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would discourage all forms of entrepreneurship
It might encourage more risk-taking and business creation
It would only support large-scale businesses
It would have no effect on entrepreneurial activities
questions.answer: It might encourage more risk-taking and business creation

questions.question: How might UBI impact informal microenterprises in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would force all microenterprises to close
It would have no effect on microenterprises
It could provide capital for expansion or formalization
It would only benefit large corporations
questions.answer: It could provide capital for expansion or formalization

questions.question: What is a potential challenge of implementing UBI in Timor-Leste's labor market?
choices: It might lead to a significant increase in unemployment
It could cause rapid inflation in the formal sector
It might initially reduce labor supply in low-wage jobs
It would eliminate all informal sector activities
questions.answer: It might initially reduce labor supply in low-wage jobs

questions.question: How might UBI affect wage negotiations in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would have no effect on wage negotiations
Employers might offer lower wages, knowing workers have a basic income
It would eliminate the need for wage negotiations
It would only affect public sector wage negotiations
questions.answer: Employers might offer lower wages, knowing workers have a basic income

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on labor migration in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would have no effect on migration patterns
It might reduce rural-to-urban migration
It would force all workers to migrate to urban areas
It would only affect international migration
questions.answer: It might reduce rural-to-urban migration

questions.question: How might UBI impact seasonal employment in Timor-Leste's agricultural sector?
choices: It would eliminate all seasonal employment
It would have no effect on seasonal work
It might provide income stability during off-seasons
It would force all agricultural workers into year-round employment
questions.answer: It might provide income stability during off-seasons

questions.question: What effect might UBI have on youth unemployment in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would eliminate youth unemployment entirely
It might enable young people to pursue education or training
It would force all young people into immediate employment
It would have no effect on youth unemployment
questions.answer: It might enable young people to pursue education or training

questions.question: How could UBI affect gender dynamics in Timor-Leste's labor market?
choices: It would have no effect on gender dynamics
It might increase women's labor force participation
It would force all women out of the labor market
It would only benefit male workers
questions.answer: It might increase women's labor force participation

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on working conditions in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would have no effect on working conditions
It might improve conditions as workers have more bargaining power
It would worsen conditions in all sectors
It would only affect working conditions in the public sector
questions.answer: It might improve conditions as workers have more bargaining power

questions.question: How might UBI impact the gig economy in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would eliminate the gig economy entirely
It might enable more people to engage in gig work
It would force all workers into traditional employment
It would have no effect on the gig economy
questions.answer: It might enable more people to engage in gig work

questions.question: What effect could UBI have on labor productivity in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would definitely decrease productivity in all sectors
It might increase productivity as workers are less stressed
It would have no effect on productivity
It would only affect productivity in the informal sector
questions.answer: It might increase productivity as workers are less stressed

questions.question: How might UBI affect the bargaining power of workers in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would eliminate the need for worker bargaining
It might increase workers' bargaining power
It would decrease workers' bargaining power in all sectors
It would only affect bargaining power in the public sector
questions.answer: It might increase workers' bargaining power

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on skills development in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would discourage all forms of skills development
It might enable workers to invest in their own skills
It would only support skills development in the formal sector
It would have no effect on skills development
questions.answer: It might enable workers to invest in their own skills

questions.question: How might UBI impact labor force participation rates in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would definitely increase participation rates across all demographics
It would definitely decrease participation rates across all demographics
It might have varied effects on different demographic groups
It would have no effect on labor force participation rates
questions.answer: It might have varied effects on different demographic groups

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on job satisfaction in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would decrease job satisfaction in all sectors
It might increase job satisfaction as workers have more choice
It would have no effect on job satisfaction
It would only affect job satisfaction in the public sector
questions.answer: It might increase job satisfaction as workers have more choice

questions.question: How might UBI affect the transition from education to employment in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would force all students to immediately enter the workforce
It might allow for a more gradual and considered transition
It would eliminate the need for higher education
It would have no effect on the education-to-employment transition
questions.answer: It might allow for a more gradual and considered transition

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on workplace innovation in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would discourage all forms of workplace innovation
It might encourage innovation as workers feel more secure
It would only support innovation in large corporations
It would have no effect on workplace innovation
questions.answer: It might encourage innovation as workers feel more secure

questions.question: How might UBI impact labor market flexibility in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would make the labor market completely rigid
It might increase flexibility as workers have a safety net
It would only affect flexibility in the informal sector
It would have no effect on labor market flexibility
questions.answer: It might increase flexibility as workers have a safety net

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on income inequality in Timor-Leste's labor market?
choices: It would eliminate all income inequality
It might reduce income inequality to some extent
It would definitely increase income inequality
It would have no effect on income inequality
questions.answer: It might reduce income inequality to some extent

questions.question: How might UBI affect labor unions in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would eliminate the need for labor unions
It might change the focus of union activities
It would strengthen all labor unions equally
It would have no effect on labor unions
questions.answer: It might change the focus of union activities

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on job security in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would eliminate all job security concerns
It might reduce anxiety about job loss
It would increase job insecurity in all sectors
It would only affect job security in the public sector
questions.answer: It might reduce anxiety about job loss

questions.question: How might UBI impact labor market entry for disadvantaged groups in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would create barriers for all disadvantaged groups
It might facilitate easier entry into the labor market
It would force all disadvantaged groups into informal work
It would have no effect on labor market entry for these groups
questions.answer: It might facilitate easier entry into the labor market

questions.question: What potential effect could UBI have on occupational mobility in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would eliminate all occupational mobility
It might increase occupational mobility
It would force everyone to change occupations regularly
It would have no effect on occupational mobility
questions.answer: It might increase occupational mobility
